lines.text: You wouldn't be trying to blackmail old J.R., would you?
Oh Barnes, you just get dumber and dumber every day.

[after Cliff is knocked out]
As my Daddy always said... The opera ain't over til the fat lady sings.

[after getting Jock's will]
Like my Daddy always said... Where there's a way, there's a will.

[to Ray after it is revealed that he is Jock's son]
There's a difference between having oil flow through your veins and fertilizer.

[Bobby is trying to make peace between J.R. and Ray]
Let's get on with it, Ray... I got getter things to do than stand around in cow dung all day long.
